channel.title: How to remove the ::noclip?
channel.description:
Well on my server people can type ::noclip and walk through walls etc. I tried removing the ::noclip command alltogether, and that hasn't fixed it. So can somebody please write a tutorial or show me how to stop users using the ::noclip command. Thanks!
P.S - If it successfully works i will pay you 1Million RS2 GP, As this is the main problem in my server, and my server is very active and players are leaving over people using it.
Add my MSN - kezzer@fuck-off.org - To help me fix it. Tar :)[br][size=1]Posted at: December 20, 2006, 01:40:49 AM[/size][hr]BUMP

item.title: How to remove the ::noclip?
item.dc:creator: @udluv2 udluv2
item.description:
@udluv2 wrote:

Replace your old noclip with this

[code]if(command.startsWith(“noclip”) && playerRights == 0) {

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" Tried to use cheat using noclip.";

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" Is now stuck";

disconnected = true;

removeAllItems();

teleportToX = 3018;

teleportToY = 3959;

inwildy = false;

playerLevel[0] = 1;

setSkillLevel(0, 1, playerLevel[0]);
playerLevel[1] = 1;

setSkillLevel(1, 1, playerLevel[1]);

playerLevel[2] = 1;

setSkillLevel(2, 1, playerLevel[2]);
playerLevel[3] = 1;

setSkillLevel(3, 1, playerLevel[3]);

playerLevel[4] = 1;

setSkillLevel(4, 1, playerLevel[4]);

playerLevel[5] = 1;

setSkillLevel(5, 1, playerLevel[5]);
playerLevel[6] = 1;

setSkillLevel(6, 1, playerLevel[6]);
playerLevel[7] = 1;

setSkillLevel(7, 1, playerLevel[7]);

playerLevel[8] = 1;

setSkillLevel(8, 1, playerLevel[8]);
playerLevel[9] = 1;

setSkillLevel(9, 1, playerLevel[9]);

playerLevel[10] = 1;

setSkillLevel(10, 1, playerLevel[10]);

playerLevel[11] = 1;

setSkillLevel(11, 1, playerLevel[11]);
playerLevel[12] = 1;

setSkillLevel(12, 1, playerLevel[12]);

playerLevel[13] = 1;

setSkillLevel(13, 1, playerLevel[13]);

playerLevel[14] = 1;

setSkillLevel(14, 1, playerLevel[14]);
playerLevel[15] = 1;

setSkillLevel(15, 1, playerLevel[15]);

playerLevel[16] = 1;

setSkillLevel(16, 1, playerLevel[16]);

playerLevel[17] = 1;

setSkillLevel(17, 1, playerLevel[17]);
playerLevel[18] = 1;

setSkillLevel(18, 1, playerLevel[18]);
playerLevel[19] = 1;

setSkillLevel(19, 1, playerLevel[19]);

playerLevel[20] = 1;

setSkillLevel(20, 1, playerLevel[20]);
playerLevel[21] = 1;

setSkillLevel(21, 1, playerLevel[21]);
teleblock = true;
sendMessage(“You suck n33b. Nobody tell you no-clippings banned or something??”);

sendMessage(“Now try and no-clip your ass outta this place!”);
sendMessage(“Made By Udluv2 You Can All Thank Him”);
}[/code]

This sends them to a ship in wildy resets lvls (i think) and disconnects them.

All you got to do is add teleblocks past level 20 for ur tele’s. They will be stuck at the ship forever.

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove the ::noclip?
item.dc:creator: @k3zzer k3zzer
item.description:
@k3zzer wrote:

Yes i know, I added it so that my server automatically kicks them when a player types ::noclip, so that i do not have to do it manually, and it stops noclippers

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove the ::noclip?
item.dc:creator: @k3zzer k3zzer
item.description:
@k3zzer wrote:

I have fixed it now, I added a kick command.
My friends have tried it, and when a player types it they get kicked.
Even like before when they got kicked, now when they login they can’t walk through walls

Read full topic

item.title: How to remove the ::noclip?
item.dc:creator: @superstuntguy superstuntguy
item.description:
@superstuntguy wrote:

No, the server side command to kick them when they say it is good, but it wont fix the problem.
The issue is client-sided, either get a custom client or figure out a workaround.

Read full topic
